adverbs.description: vulgarly (comparative more vulgarly, superlative most vulgarly)

entries.meaning: In a vulgar manner; obscenely or unrefinedly.
In the manner of the common people.
examples: The last, the knotted fucus, which has long slender stalks, leaves small, bulbs or vesicles in the middle of the stalks, vulgarly called eelwrack, is most esteemed by our kelp-makers.
